New Records: The Dodgers tied the postseason record of 33 consecutive scoreless innings with a combined three-hitter in the game.
The largest shutout victory margin in Dodgers postseason history and the Mets' most one-sided postseason shutout defeat occurred in this game.
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty pitched a three-hitter, allowing only two hits over seven innings.
Shohei Ohtani contributed with a 2-for-4 performance, scoring two runs and driving in another.
Mookie Betts added a three-run double in the eighth inning, which was the largest shutout victory margin in Dodgers postseason history.
Pre-Game Insights: The game marked the Dodgers' first scoreless postseason start of seven-plus innings since Clayton Kershaw's eight innings in the 2020 NL Wild Card Series.
The matchup included Kodai Senga's third overall start, which was decimated by injuries, and Max Muncy's early two-run single.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a sellout with 53,503 fans in attendance.
The Dodgers' victory was their pursuit of a record 25th NL pennant.
Others: The game was the first of a best-of-seven series in the NLCS.
